website_summaries.verdict: The built-in dual channels maximizes download speed on this unit, while a push button connection makes setup easy on this unit for those who are not tech savvy.
pros: The range is broad enough to cover multiple levels of average-sized homes
Dual band assigns devices to the best channel to reduce interference and increase download speeds
The device includes four Ethernet ports for wired connectivity
Locates a user's router through the push of a button, making setup simple
The AC1200 can also function as an access point
cons: When used as an access point, the Ethernet ports are disabled

customer_reviews.title: Loses connection every day for an hour or two.
customer_reviews.text: The bandwidth is very good. The look is great. The inclusion of an Ethernet port is great for smart TVs. But, it just keeps losing connectivity. About 1-2 times a day it just loses connectivity. It will correct itself in a couple hours. It can be very frustrating if you have something set to default to it such as a smart TV as you have to change your connection until it gets its act together. When it works... great. Otherwise, very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Achour

customer_reviews.title: The blinking orange light (the lower of two) means the Firmware is upgrading...
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't figure out why pressing the WPS button on the router and then the extender didn't work and then I read what the flashing orange for that light meant. The power cord meant that I could place it on the shelf of the utility room closet where the extenders that mount on the outlet wouldn't fit. That eliminated the interference from the wire mesh in the plaster walls since the utility room, where the router is located, is Sheetrock and it's a straight line of sight from the DAP-1650 through the doors to the kitchen to the dining room where the Laptop is located Speeds from the extender with 100 Mbps service runs 92-100 Mbps...
customer_reviews.author: Strnj1

customer_reviews.title: Fail.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy enough to configure, and does what it is supposed to do when it is functioning, but the light flashes yellow randomly and when it does that, it loses its lock with the router it is extending and internet connectivity is lost. It is probably down 20 mins of every hour. I will be damned if I waste any more time on this, as others have. Easier to put back in its box and return to Amazon (thanks, Amazon)!
customer_reviews.author: HappyAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Keeps dropping connection
customer_reviews.text: It drops connection with my router at least twice a week on a good week. Sometimes it would drop connection 5 times in one hour. I would have to keep power cycling to get it to reconnect. I was using this to have a hardwired connection for my PS4, thinking that it would be a faster and more stable connection than connecting the console through wifi. It turned out neither of those two expectations came true. Losing connection in the middle of an online game over and over is very frustrating! Somewhat disappointed in the brand since I've had good experiences with some of their other products before.
customer_reviews.author: N K

customer_reviews.title: Wifi signal faster than wired cable
customer_reviews.text: Mine is DAP1650. I bought this because we have a TV box for that we think cable is better for streaming. It's quite easy to install and use. However, we found its cable speed is slower than its wifi speed. Yes, I tried to test their download speed using a PC, with its cable and its wifi, respectively. Cable gives you only 5~6 Mbps while the Wifi gives you like more than 50 Mbps (the router provides > 70 Mbps ). How does this happen? I thought cable would be more powerful in streaming but it's NOT. Anyway, the wifi is still fast enough to support the streaming, so no complain... Overall its good for now.
customer_reviews.author: Lifan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent solution to bridge WiFi network to wired switch
customer_reviews.text: My house is not wired so a "bridge" was the natural choice. I purchased one and then another one later on because I needed a wired connection. I was delighted at how simple these were to set up compared to my two previous purchases. My previous bridges were respectively a Netgear WGPS606 print server and a DAP-1522 Range Extender. (Yes. both served as wired bridges on a Wi-Fi network) I was getting lower speeds on them until recently when I changed the channel on my Linksys EA6900 Router. According to Speedtest ,the farthest room in my house went from 15Mbs 85Mbps. It's still not LAN speeds but quite acceptable for HD streaming.
customer_reviews.author: L. Autry

customer_reviews.title: Limited range
customer_reviews.text: The 4 ethernet ports are great, the setup was quick and easy. If you are using this device to extend the range of your wifi inside your house this would probably be great but there are a lot less expensive options available that will serve as well. I needed to extend the range of my Wifi to my detached garage for older devices I have there that just do not have sufficient signal strength or antenna to connect to the router inside the house. Note that my business class laptop and iPhone XR have no problem connecting to the house router from inside the garage. This device, however, was not able to see the home router while in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I was desperate to extend my WiFi signal to my back yard and my office as it once worked there and then stopped for various reasons. After much research I found this device that was highly recommended by two different tech websites. I have a SUPER strong signal in my back yard and I can move its position in the house to gain WiFi upstairs again as well. I live in a smallish row-home under 2k sq feet for reference. Simple and fast set up as well as reboot if I need to move it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Paulson

customer_reviews.title: At Your Own Risk
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. The unit would not operate without first performing a manual firmware update. When I looked online, I saw that the firmware version the unit shipped with had a critical security fault. Rather than recall or fix their units with the faulty firmware, D-Link is just selling them anyway and asking the customer to apply the fix. I don't mind updating firmware, but selling units with known critical security risks without informing the customer of that fact is bad business. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Looses contact frequently...
customer_reviews.text: This only works if you get lucky. Frequently looses contact with main wireless router. It does not synch automatically. You keep fiddling with WPS and praying it will connect again. Very frustrating experience using it. Dont waste your money. I am not sure if it is not too late to return this product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Seshadri

customer_reviews.title: Strong signal, but lots of connection and control issues.
customer_reviews.text: We are using this to repeat a wifi signal in a church. While the wireless signal is fast, we have had a ton of issues connecting to the signal. A lot of people's phones will come back as incorrect password when trying to connect despite using the right password. Also equipment that we wirelessly try to control through this unit will often disconnect or not work. Would not recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: I have used many of these Range extenders. I installed this particular one at my mother-in-law's house to reach wireless up to a bedroom that could not get signal. This worked so well we could get almost full speed from the router without having to run a cable. She was able to stream netflix and hulu without issues now and her wifi calling was able to work after installing this, as they have no cell service where they live.
customer_reviews.author: Diesel

customer_reviews.title: All-in-one extender, bridge, access point, switch. Excellent device, great price, simple setup
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. I was looking for a flexible device that could function as a bridge, not just an access point or extender, and this fit the bill. Not just that, but it's a 4-port switch too. And it uses the Ac1200 wifi standard (very fast) as well as g, n etc. My ac1200 cable modem is located in an inconvenient non-central location in my house, so I have it beaming to this device, which in turn is wired to a desktop pc, a NAS, and several other devices. Works wonderfully. Amazing price, and incredibly easy to set up. Literally took about 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: P. Heald

customer_reviews.title: It’s awesome WiFi extender 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.text: This device is amazing ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️, I tried couple devices before this kind of plug to the wall’s outlet it just piece of junk 👎 and finally I found the D-link AC1200 🎉🎊 and just was the right one from the design, easy to install, strong signal, amazing functionality, and more . I very like it and very recommend Thanks for the seller And I can’t understand who put negative stars for the product I can’t believe theme Buy it with confidence 👍⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.author: Bahaa

customer_reviews.title: A little slow but syncs quickly!
customer_reviews.text: It works good and easy to sync with home router. Only issue is the signal seems weak and the range isn’t great. downloading picture or video content is slower than main router. But it worked to link a local device to communicate with my computer just fine. There maybe other set up options that would help with issues I experienced for main connect to the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Trent Bogard

customer_reviews.title: User error?
customer_reviews.text: I moved in to my basement. And I was trying to extend my 200 mbps single. I got 80 at best. It might be my fault doe to the fact I am in the basement. Or my modem couldn't handle that range. So I can't say it has a great reach. I have no clue how the quality of the singal is for that reason
customer_reviews.author: Dom Sora

customer_reviews.title: Truly duplicates the signal in hard to reach areas.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow instructions despite the WPS function not working. Installation instructions for browser installation were extremely easy to follow and were also used to install another manufacturers product. I’ve been able to expand my WiFi signal across the entire main floor of my house. WIth a few more expanders, I will have the entire house and yard covered.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A piece of Crap!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The worst piece of crap i have ever bought. This device really sucks. I notice I started having problems a few weeks ago with it constantly booting up and then scanning for a signal. Tonight i decided to plug in my main IP router address and monitor this specific device and discovered it keeps changing the Ip address. within 2-minutes this device had 7 different IP's assigned to it at any given time. Really sucks that I cannot return it for a refund. I will be contacting my credit card company to see what they can do!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Pretty dismal on all fronts. Sounds good on the surface but useless after setup. Support is a joke. Try unplugging it. Try restarting it. Bought it to get signal in the detached garage and it couldn’t do that. Went with an alternative I already had with ZERO issues. Brick returned, les my time. At least they let me take it to Kohls instead of having to actually ship it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Apparently third time is the charm...
customer_reviews.text: This! I finally found what I was looking for, after poor results from a USB WiFi adapter on my desktop, and a competitor's sad attempt at a cheap knockoff of one of these devices, this is something that should be very simple, this isn't new technology. This just connects to my main WiFi router (and it is a good one) and stays connected, at my full rated 250Mbps internet, all day long, no stupid annoying dropped signal for no reason, no drops in speed. It was easy to setup, and it is very easy to change its operating mode. I set it up and was able to forget it was there. This is good.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Unstable and crahses all the time
customer_reviews.text: Had issues with this device since it came out of the box. It seems the firmware of this extender is buggie and the throughput really goes low several times a week. The original network becomes stronger than the extended network! Youd need to reset it to get the throughput back which is a pain if you are working from home and you get cut off in the middle of meetings!
customer_reviews.author: Rouzbeh Kashef

customer_reviews.title: Works great and stably as a WAP
customer_reviews.text: I am using it as a wireless access point. I was a bit nervous about doing so instead of buying a dedicated WAP and got even more wary when the box made no mention of this configuration. Alas, there was no worry. It is no problem, the instructions were manageable to follow for this non-technie. It took a couple of tries but I got it. Once set up it is a VERY solid wireless and wired connection. It is observably faster than the Zyxtel WAP3205 it replaced but I can't say if that is due to the old WAPs degradation over several years or out of box better technology.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz Max

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be easier to get great wi-fi!
customer_reviews.text: To those who wrote that these units were difficult to set - Dlink must have heard you, because I just got one and they couldn't be any easier. Plug it in to power. Connect an Ethernet LAN cable into your router and the DAP-1650. Type in dlinkap.local into your web browser. Presto! The setup page comes up. A few clicks later and you're done. I installed one downstairs and another upstairs and I now have maximum wifi signal throughout my home.
customer_reviews.author: Ed E. Morawski

customer_reviews.title: buy, setup and forget, works great
customer_reviews.text: After 6 years Dlink WAP started to fail. It was time to replace with newer one. Since all neighbors have 802.11n network, I needed media bridge that is compatible with new 802.11ac WAP. Since this unit can work on both bands at the same time, it has 2 mac addresses for each band. Once I got that squared away, it connected and works like it should. Didn't have to touch it for few days and didn't see any dropped packets or connectivity issues. Dlink makes great products, especially in business line.
customer_reviews.author: compugirl

customer_reviews.title: I'm quite disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite disappointed with this product. I bought it to increase the speed of my wireless network to go along with the gigbit switches and router, and the 200 Mbps Internet (download) speed. Sadly, the range on this WAP is FAR inferior to my old one. I can't even go to the end of my back porch anymore, and that's line of sight 30-40 feet. Distance tests have all been with my phone which does connect at a higher speed (as if I need high bandwidth to my phone!) Sadly my laptop wi-fi isn't new enough to get the higher speed, so it's overall worse for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Porterfield

customer_reviews.title: I tried 5 different WiFi extenders before this D-Link
customer_reviews.text: This extender is the best! I tried 5 different WiFi extenders before this and all had issues or poor performance. Just pressed the WPS buttons and it was hooked up. Even uses the password of my main modem. Walked the property after install and I have WiFi everywhere. Like a bonfire, I’m stoked!
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WHEN IT WANTS TO
customer_reviews.text: THE EXTENDER IS 30 FEET FROM THE MODEM,3 BARS OF SIGNAL ON MY PHONE. THE EXTENDER CANT CONNECT WITH THE MODEM WHEN IT DOES THE SIGNAL LASTS ONLY ABOUT 15 MIN, THEN IT DROPS OUT AND IT TAKES 30 MIN TO AN HR TO RECONNECT TO THE MODEM. I HAVE ONLY HAD IT FOR 6 HOURS AND I AM SENDING IT BACK, I WANTED TO HOOK UP SOME SECURITY CAMERAS TO IT BUT I DONT THINK it's GOING TO WORK, I WILL BE BETTER OFF MOVING THE MODEM NEXT TO THE CAMERAS RECORDER
customer_reviews.author: PHILIP R.

customer_reviews.title: Works well as a bridge
customer_reviews.text: I connected one as a bridge between the wifi from my office and the entertainment center downstairs in the living room. The connection is typically 145 Mbps to the Comcast speed test from my entertainment center. That is plenty --- 5x faster than is needed for good video streaming. And this unit may not be the limiting factor. No wires needed.
customer_reviews.author: Stark R.

customer_reviews.title: Don't know if it's working
customer_reviews.text: I would say you need to be savvy about networking and how it works. I will have to do more research, and the customers ' comments are helpful. But the lower light is amber, and the connection from my fire stick keeps dropping. There might be several issues going on, including operator error. But I followed the instructions and have no improvement in my signal. I would not recommend this unless you know what you are doing. Not enough explanation in the instructions and not very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Droid

customer_reviews.title: Limitation on Selecting Wireless Channels for 2.4 GHz
customer_reviews.text: My use for this device is as an access point. The manual did not provide any guidance on configuration as an AP, but I was able to muddle through it in about 45 minutes. The bands are set for auto channel determination by default, and the 2.4 GHz frequency locks on to Channel 1. My network analyzer indicates that Channel 14 would be the best choice. So I go into configuration to set the Channel manually for Channel 14, and all the drop down is allowing me to select is Channels 1 through 11. Not sure why this is, as I have the latest build.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Berg

customer_reviews.title: Probably good at shorter distances.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received wouldn't power up. I believe the AC adapter was bad. I returned it and immediately received a 2nd one. It worked perfectly next to my router, but lacked the ability to provide good signal for my needs as an extender approximately 50" from my router, and 3 internal residential walls away. My actual router was better at that distance than was this as an extender.
customer_reviews.author: Shayne A.

customer_reviews.title: Better than before
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in lieu of a ceiling mounted access point - mostly because I knew I could set it up instantly and I was being lazy. I also liked that it provides additional ethernet ports, which is great if used on a work desk. I use it as a wired access point and keep it on my nightstand on the opposite side of the house as my AT&T router. They share the same SSIDs so that theoretically devices should hop from one AP to the other. I'm not convinced that it always functions that way, but certainly my wireless signal is consistently stronger AND it provides an additional USB charging port for my Apple watch on my nightstand.
customer_reviews.author: D. Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions and couldn’t get to connect to internet
customer_reviews.text: I normally don’t write reviews on Amazon. But needed to advise the frustration I went through for several hours. Poor instructions came with this wireless device, even instructional video on line was dead end, tech support even worse because my existing D-Link router I was connecting to was out of warranty. They wouldn’t help me with set up unless I paid a fee. Ok....so I just bought a competitors model, packed this one up and sent it back. Actually was able to buy 2 wireless extenders for 1/2 the price of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Diane P.

customer_reviews.title: Stuck in orange blinking mode
customer_reviews.text: It worked kind-of well for some time. Occasionally disconnecting. I switched to Verizon and decided not to use it for a while, now trying to get it back to work... it won't connect to the Verizon network. I tried everything possible. At the end factory reset, doing the 30/30/30 reset, etc, wasted 6 hours or more over several days trying to get it to work. It's stuck in orange blinking mode which suggests that "A firmware upgrade is in progress" ... it stays like that for many hours... I am going to throw it in the garbage and move on.
customer_reviews.author: Desso

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Seemed easy enough to install, despite having terribly-written instructions that made lots of assumptions and left key details out. But could never get it to work. After three attempts to get in contact with their "24/7" tech support, including once through an amazon customer support agent, we could never get a hold of anybody. I'm returning the item, writing this review, and will be reporting them to the BBB today for their dodgy customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Letsgopens!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, and good WiFi range.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to extend my WiFi coverage while still allowing all devices to share the same network (regardless of whether they connected to my main router or the AC1200). I decided to set up the AC1200 as an access point, hardwired to my main router (to avoid the connectivity and latency problems associated with range extenders that connect wirelessly). To accomplish this, i purchased 2 D-Link Powerline AV2 2000 adapters, from Amazon. I plugged one adapter into my main router, and another into an AC outlet on the other side of my house. I then plugged my AC1200 into the adapter's RJ45 port and presto... a screaming fast, latency-free extension of my existing network.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stamatis

customer_reviews.title: I like the potential flexibility of this item (extender or access ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to extend my existing home network by creating an access point (this is wired by ethernet to the router, and then other items are both wired to it and it expands my wifi coverage). Installation went mostly smoothly although it took some experimenting to get it to adopt the existing network names without trying to create an EXT extension. I like the potential flexibility of this item (extender or access point). I have been very satisfied with DLink support across a range of items (apps, online support, and phone). Since adding this, my home coverage is seamless throughout the entire two-level house with no drop in speed anywhere, which means it did exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great range, lasting operation...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I live in an older house that is divided into apartments and my apartment happens to have a concrete fireplace that my office router finds difficult to penetrate. I was looking for something that could extend the range of the router and provide dual-band access at any point in my apartment and this device does the trick. If you are not used to setting up routers, you may find the set-up instructions a little intimidating, but I promise it is worth the time and effort. I have had ZERO issues with this device after 5 months and counting, and I hope to use it for a long as I can.
customer_reviews.author: Justin W.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This really did the trick to extend the WIFI from my den into my living room so all my ALEXA capable devices got a great strong signal. Setting up took some time . . . but then . . . I guess I am not a genius, stable or otherwise. But it worked in the end. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J B Lesleh

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great Wi-Fi repeater I have it in my bedroom that carries the signal throughout the house and actually has a better signal then my router I have it hard wired with for ethernet cables connected to it that a run to my TV computer and 2 monitors very good bye
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective right out of the box. Customer support unable to help besides forcing me to pay to ship a replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Defective right out of the box. Would function for a few minutes at slow speeds / weak signal before automatically "updating firmware" every single day for up to 12 hours at a time (when, of course, no firmware updates were available). Purchased in December, still waiting on a replacement unit from D-Link per their warranty (side note: customer has to pay to ship to and from D-Link to get a replacement, what a joke), so it's too late to just file a claim through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk for the money.  Don’t waste it.
customer_reviews.text: I should have written this review a long time ago. This is a piece of junk for the money. When the Internet here goes out and then comes back on all my other extenders grab the wifi signal and reconnect on their own. This thing will not and has to be reset (turned off and back on) every time. A true pain.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Now what coach?
customer_reviews.text: So I plugged the AC1200, the power light turned solid green. I pressed the WPS Button on my router, and pressed the WPS button on the AC1200, the WiFi led flashed yellow. The installation instructions state this means that the firmware/software is updating. Does this mean it is actually updating or does something else need to be done? If so what? Apparently the firmware software update takes a long time. The wifi led change over night from Sunday into Monday October 16th.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis L. Wichman

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and plays nice sign others.
customer_reviews.text: I have a D-Link DIR-655 router. Plugged in this DAP-1650, waited for the light to go green, pressed the WPS button on my router, pressed the WPS button on the DAP-1650, logged in with the info on the little card, set it up as a bridge, done. Unplugged it brought it up to my attic and plugged in my Ethernet device up there. Works - no problems - plays nice with everything. I wanted to make sure my smartthings hub could talk to everything inside and outside of my house. I had to get it away from all the electronics by my router. Everything works great now.
customer_reviews.author: LittleReadBooks 'n' MoreTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: After 3 months, not working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in April 2019, it is now July 2019 and after that short amount of time it is already not working. I have this extender sitting maybe 20 feet from my main Modem/Router. I plug another desktop PC directly into the Ethernet port to use it for another Desktop. It is constantly losing it's signal from the main Router/Modem. This issue is NOT with my main Router because everything else connected to it is having Zero issues. This Dlink extender is junk in my opinion!! It will NOT maintain connection with the Main Modem/Router after only 3 months of use!
customer_reviews.author: RJ Hansford

customer_reviews.title: Did not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This WiFi repeater did not extend my home's WiFi signal at all. All of the settings were correct and placement was optimal. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Williams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: This extender/access point works great. I use it as an access point, connecting it to my router with Cat 6 cable, to provide full wireless coverage at the other end of my house. It broadcasts a full-strength wireless signal into 3 rooms that always were unreachable with the router. I've wanted a device like this for 5 years - other range extenders always transmitted a weakened signal - configuring this as an access point delivers a full-strength signal. The network name for the D-link signal is different, with its own password, but that is a small price to pay for a full-strength signal.
customer_reviews.author: A. P.

customer_reviews.title: Its reception is worse than my phone's.
customer_reviews.text: The DAP-1650 would not connect to an open wifi hotspot and act as an extender, but my phone could perform the same function. The reception on this is pathetic. Its output may be fine, but for receiving signals, it is garbage. I am sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: James Hood

customer_reviews.title: BEST NETWORK EXTENDER ON THE MARKET
customer_reviews.text: I googled "Best Network Extender on the market". Obviously, this extender was rated the highest. Works wonderful and very easy to install. Works beautifully with my Alexa. I highly recommend this product. Thank you for creating such a good item.
customer_reviews.author: Liz R.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my time!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and small gadget but couldn't get it to pair with my router. I checked several other reviews and this has happened to other people, too. So maybe some of the units are defective. I just sent it back and received a refund; I had already spent 4hrs on trying to get it to work and I wasn't about to waste anymore time on trying again on a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: TDB

customer_reviews.title: Great media bridge! Big boost to my XBox!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a wired bridge solution for my entertainment center electronics and video game systems for years. I tried different options from other bridges to direct power line adapters. This is by far the best solution. It runs smoothly and the speeds are as fast as my wired connection. It even bumped the speed of my XBox by 10Mbps going from WiFi to this bridge. Obviously this needs to be within a reasonable distance from the main WiFi signal but line if sight does not seem to be a factor at all.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stern

customer_reviews.title: Good range, easy setup, Guest not secure
customer_reviews.text: While the range and setup work without issue, the guest network is not secure if you have multiple subnets, so 1 star down for that (see below). Excellent range and we were able to eliminate an additional access point now that the space is covered with the DAP-1650 The Guest network can access other subnets on the network with WLAN checked. The subnet the DAP-1650 is connected to is blocked, for us (192.168.0.xxx), but our VPN connected subnet (192.168.1.xxx) can still be accessed. All locally routed 192.168.xxx.xxx should be blocked on the guest net to prevent security problems.
customer_reviews.author: Carol C.

customer_reviews.title: I stuck this in my attic and ran cat5 to the basement where my other router is.  It's dandy.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty easy to get this up and running, and it has a lot of advanced configuration options for even more flexibility. I haven't had any range or performance issues. I set this up on channels that don't overlap with my other router and everything is great. I'm connecting it to my router via cat5 but it can also operate in bridging mode which is helpful. It's nondescript and not unattractive so if you can't tuck it away it won't be an eyesore if it's sitting out on a desk or shelf.
customer_reviews.author: MyItchyChin

customer_reviews.title: Basic usage only; power users need not apply
customer_reviews.text: Firmware appears to be very basic. I configured as a Media bridge; but it does not appear to have many configurable options. NTP cannot be configured outside of Dlink's servers. Doesn't appear to get any Firmware updates for security still at 1.03. Doesn't offer to disable or enable internal DHCP server in MB mode. It does it's job; but appears to be un-flexible in it's application.
customer_reviews.author: Zitt

customer_reviews.title: Good signal quality for a far away signal.
customer_reviews.text: I am using it as a signal extender. It has a powerful receiving antenna and I bring the signal from another house to my house; the two houses are about 130 feet away, and there are walls, trees and fences in the way. It is simple to use and its performance is fast.
customer_reviews.author: I. Hdez.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for. I read some reviews that were a bit negative but, as with all networking products, you have to figure that the lower 10-15% of reviews involve 'trouble in the cockpit' (so to speak). I use this to extend an existing wifi network and use the wired gigabit ports for connecting my main DAW computer (mac) to my music server (PC running VE Pro). Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Zoda

customer_reviews.title: Streaming throughout the house
customer_reviews.text: I needed a Wi-Fi extender to permit streaming to a smart tv located two stories below my router in a house with brick and plaster walls and hardwood floors. The D-link does the job. Although installation involved a good bit if running up and down stairs, I was able to do it without assistance. The results are entirely satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Frank O. File

customer_reviews.title: Works well and prevents Wifi dead spots. I stream through this appliance with no problems.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to get signal to all corners of my house. My three story home has a hard time getting good coverage for Wifi. This extends the signal of my wireless 802.11N signal to my basement. Just as advertised my speed is about 50% of max speed but I'm not downloading large files when on the extender. It works just fine streaming to my phone or TV over the extender.
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: Had to set up in my barn after connecting via wps which is quite a distance and this still works good. I am able to get wifi out in pasture quite a distance. This is excellent for wifi calling as I do not have very good cell reception.
customer_reviews.author: cowboy

customer_reviews.title: So far, middling performance, lacks some features.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly straight-forward to setup. Supports AP mode, but doesn't appear to be able to provide DHCP services as my DAP-1522 does. So far it doesn't seem to provide Wi-Fi any faster or more reliably than my DAP-1522, either, but I will be doing a little more testing. Seems to support IPv6 much more readily. Coverage around the house does appear to be very good. Due to a presumed bug in the firmware that shipped, I was unable to directly upgrade from the device. I had to download, unzip, and upload the .bin file.
customer_reviews.author: Don Reese

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great. Initially I used it as a wireless bridge ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked Great. Initially I used it as a wireless bridge to extend my network from my upstairs router to my entertainment center downstairs. It performed great. But recently I purchased a set of DECA adapters to convert my old unused Coax to an ethernet network. So now I am using it as an access point extending my wireless network. Love the versatility of the device that can function as an access point, a repeater, or a bridge for such a great price.
customer_reviews.author: James C Barrows

customer_reviews.title: Nice to get a product that does everything it is advertised to do
customer_reviews.text: This extender is really does just what we wanted it to to do. The connection was simple and quick. The WIFI strength was extended all the way to the back of our house as if I was standing next to the router. The system has been very reliable even hooks back up on it's after a power outage. Nice to get a product that does everything it is advertised to do.
customer_reviews.author: p5mann

customer_reviews.title: Fails to work as an Extender.  DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.text: The wizard walk-through allows you to setup the device as an Extender. But fails to connect to the internet after setting up to work with your Router. Big waste of time. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: A high quality flexible product
customer_reviews.text: I use a Unix based firewall, and it took a couple of returns to find a device that can just be a wireless access point without trying to do things I didn't need done. Configuration was easy, several modes make it possible to use this device any way you like, and I've been using it for months with no issues. The only problem I've had is that I can't get back into the configuration the way the instructions say, but I haven't really needed to, so it's notmuch of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Klaatu

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performer and attractive alternative form factor
customer_reviews.text: I really like the form factor. It looks much less techy than an antenna farm on most units when placed in the area of my Home Theater equipment. Setup as an Access Point was very easy, and it has performed well in the month or so since I installed it, with not glitches or need for any reboots.
customer_reviews.author: Vicw

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use mainly as a wireless bridge for my Samsung Smart TV that was having an issue staying connected to my Asus router. I have not had any problems accessing the internet with my TV since I installed extender. The only slight drawback is that streaming does not work well (4K at least), but I use my Roku mainly for that anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Beavis

customer_reviews.title: Setup nightmare - never worked. Firmware.
customer_reviews.text: 2 hours of frustration. Never did get it to connect to my router via wps buttons. Chat help was a waste, unable to answer my questions. Firmware update button indicated update was happening but never completed. Tried getting update via the app, but their link went to a suspect site. There is no number to call listed in the quickstart guide. I bought this because so many other reviews extolled how easy the setup was. That was definitely not my experience. I will be returning this tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Review for using this is as access point
customer_reviews.text: My router's 5ghz signal was very weak for a few of my devices, resulting in very slow speeds. I set this up as an access point (hard wired to the router and broadcasting a wireless signal with a unique SSID) and the signal is strong and the speeds are where they should be. Setup of the device itself took about 2 minutes; as long as you know what you want to use it for it's very simple and straightforward. Please note that I haven't used this as a range extender or media bridge so I can't review those functions.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job....
customer_reviews.text: This extended my wifi signal to my front porch from an upstairs router. Now have rock solid wifi in and around the perimeter of my home. The only caveat is the speed but fast enough to get by....
customer_reviews.author: mrwilli

customer_reviews.title: Reliable product and reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the multi-operational version. Initially will use as an extender only but probably will use it as an access point eventually. Primarily purchased due to the 5.0 support, since I wanted to stabilize streaming to a couple of Samsung TV's. Also have an older desktop connection to the 5.0 extender . I have had excellent results with all D-Link which I have pruchased.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Its doesn't get to much signal, the expansion is less that 1 room, I have to much trouble to connect
customer_reviews.author: joseluicito

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get it to work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping to use it to connect my computer to wifi via a LAN cable for the wifi deadzone on the second floor of a small house. Could not get this to work no matter what I tried (hard reset, power cycle, setting it up close to the router then moving it to the second floor). I gave up and returned it. I bought the TP-Link relay instead, which worked perfectly. I may have gotten a defective D-Link unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to extend my existing wireless network for better coverage on the second floor of my home
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected! I wanted to extend my existing wireless network for better coverage on the second floor of my home, as well as add Wireless-N capabilities to a desktop that only had an older Wireless-G card. The only downside is you are halving the transfer speed between extender and router. Even still, I went from a very unstable 100mbps wireless connection with buffering video streaming to a constant 144mbps connection that now works very consistently and smoothly. My results at SpeedTest.net also increased by about 5-8MBps on both laptop and smartphone connections while using the extender upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for with my AT&T residential gateway modem
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this to install no matter how many times I tried. It does not seem to work with my AT&T Residential Gateway modem. I have a feeling it is the modem, so I don't want to be too critical of the product. But I had to return it because my computers could not recognize the extender. Too bad because this unit works as more than an extender. I ended up going with NETGEAR N300 Wi-Fi Range Extender - Wall Plug Version (WN3000RP) which works great.
customer_reviews.author: Decatur GA girl

customer_reviews.title: Easy as pie
customer_reviews.text: Just worked. I bought it to add wifi to my Ethernet connected brother printer/scanner. I didn't use the WPS method to attach to my existing wifi network. Instead I logged into the DAP itself using the info on the little wifi config card and then used the DAP's browser-based config from safari on my MacBook Air. Plugged in my printer and it's all good. Took about 15 minutes. -1 star because I've only had it running for about 1/2 hour so can't comment on reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Vonchor Plunkforth

customer_reviews.title: Fairly Easy setup, but you have to do a little deduction if not using as an extender...
customer_reviews.text: Got this to swap out another router we have as an access point. To set it up as a wired access point off the backend of your main router, you have to do some digging as the setup wizard doesn't do that automatically. Basically, login to the unit and change the function of the unit on the set-up page. Then it's fairly straightforward. After I got that figured out, it has worked great! Definitely increased our range out into the backyard, so I'm very happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: Nellie

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and easily programmable.
customer_reviews.text: This multi-purpose unit has already served me well both as an access point and now as a media bridge. When configured as an access point wired to my cable modem, it provided Wi-Fi access for my laptop and cabled access to my desktop PC and shared printer. As a media bridge: with my desktop hardwired, it provides the Wi-Fi link to my wireless hotspot, while the laptop accesses the hotspot directly.
customer_reviews.author: Springbok

customer_reviews.title: excellent wireless antenna/range extender. sleek design, mountable.
customer_reviews.text: excellent wireless antenna/range extender. sleek design, mountable. offers two wireless bands, 2.4 and 5.0. i configured the 2.4 using wpa/tpik. speed a bit slower but compatibility better, esp. for older equipment (computers, cameras etc). i configured the second wireless band (5.0) using wpa2/aes - this is faster, a bit more secure and more compatible with newer equipment. costs a bit more but worth it. good brand and good tech support. strong signal carries a good distance.
customer_reviews.author: Perspectech

customer_reviews.title: HOW GOOD IS THAT
customer_reviews.text: In one word "AWESOME" I WAS SKEPTICAL ABOUT THIS DEVICE, HAD A PLAN B ON THE BACK BURNER, RUNNING A LAN WIRE TO AN ACCESS POINT. WELL THIS THING DOES 1, 2 OR 3 THINGS, EXTENDER, ROUTER ACCESS POINT AND ... AH YES, IT HAS PORTS FOR LAN WIRED CONNECTIONS! HOW GOOD IS THAT?
customer_reviews.author: SAUM-25

customer_reviews.title: That allowed me to locate the D-Link in a better location and I get far better and faster wireless ...
customer_reviews.text: I turned off the radios in my old router and configured this D-Link as an Access Point (plugged into a LAN port on the gigabit router). That allowed me to locate the D-Link in a better location and I get far better and faster wireless coverage than before. It is a nice looking and unobtrusive device that most people wouldn't even notice as it sits on top of a bookshelf. Configuration was very straight forward and easy to accomplish.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Epperson

customer_reviews.title: Great Range Extender
customer_reviews.text: Top of the line range extender. Easy set up, no problems with Wi-Fi to the TV, now
customer_reviews.author: Chuck81008

customer_reviews.title: Not for Apple
customer_reviews.text: Spent over an hour myself and with D-Link tech support trying to get this router to work with my Apple Airport Extreme Time Capsule. We finally got it going, but it's definitely not Apple-User-Friendly! Sent it back, wouldn't want to go through that again.
customer_reviews.author: Z-Shutterbug

customer_reviews.title: They Work, Reliable Connections, No Problems.
customer_reviews.text: These D-Link units do the job right for you. I have two, one for a living room entertainment center, run, as a media Ethernet connection point, the other for a bed room entertainment center, used in the extender mode. Once, setup, they have done, what I wanted and expected without any issues. Which, I can't say, about the NetGear units, the D-Links replaced. It's a pleasure to go to your Smart TV, BluRay or TiVo and they work without network, WiFi connection issues.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Horvath

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for your desktop...
customer_reviews.text: .. it looks nice but performance is atrocious. I got this to place downstairs in my media closet. Connected to my router (TP-LINK Archer C9) via a Cat5 cable. My 5GHz AC connection through the C9 (upstairs, back of house, inside another closet) is far better than the 5GHz on the D-Link, a mere 15 feet away. Unfortunately I waited past my 30 days and now I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rochambeaux

customer_reviews.title: don't expect miracles
customer_reviews.text: its better but not a whole bunch , only had to go across the room but its still better, not like WOW.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Fast, easy solution
customer_reviews.text: Works great for creating better access in a larger space. It was a no-brainer to set up, by plugging it in and accessing the home internet connection. Occasionally, the signal has dropped (typically due to power disruptions in the house) but it reconnects easily by simply pressing the access button. Love that it uses the latest AC wireless technology for faster speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Jack1963

customer_reviews.title: Super signal ncrease!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this DAP-1650 (AC1200) as an extender. Had to call tech (AR004684) for an orange blinking light which prevented it from connecting to the internet. Found out it was just meant it was doing a firmware up grade. He then walked me through the setup and got me up and running. The unit is downstairs and has increase my wi-fi signal for whole house and patio. Thank you tech support!
customer_reviews.author: James Orzech

customer_reviews.title: because it picked up our wi-if router signal great, but we could not get internet connected with ...
customer_reviews.text: The set up was east with this, but after multiple attempts gave up on this item, because it picked up our wi-if router signal great, but we could not get internet connected with any of our devices on the signals we received from this extender.
customer_reviews.author: Heather cheek

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Made big difference in replacing old DAP (9 years old). Have had no issues with it (running for 4 months)
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved!!!
customer_reviews.text: Needed to extend my WiFi network for a ranch style home to get a strong signal in a back room. Since I've used D-Link products in the past I got this one and wasn't disappointed. Had it set up and configured within 15 minutes of taking it out of the box. I now have a strong signal all over the house on both 5G and 2.4G bands. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: KGW

customer_reviews.title: Internet without boundaries.
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble setting up as an access point. Instructions don't point you to the right direction as the trouble shooting steps were a little more in depth and required a few more steps. Had to make a call to technical support. After about 5 minutes and a few configuration changes I was up and running. This extender rocks! As an access point I have to hardwire the extender to my modem/router. This truly gives the extender a direct feed and distributes the signals using it's wireless transmitters. I'm a happy camper, especially since I bought it used from Amazon, and got it for a good price. Kudos to D-Link tech support.
customer_reviews.author: FireMedic

customer_reviews.title: DLink always works well with zero issues.
customer_reviews.text: works great. I have been using Dlink routers & APs for a few years now. Never have issues. Some new homes require a hardwired access point on each floor for reliable wifi coverage & speeds. After many problems with netgear, Im loyal to Dlink. I even tried Amped wireless, and the Dlink works much better. Thanks. I would recommend DLINK to other buyers, especially if you have an older router, or if other brands not working well.
customer_reviews.author: Joey A

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, rock solid performance.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit for over two years and it has been extremely stable and performed very well. I use it in access point mode with a powerline ethernet connection back to my router, which gives much more reliable signal strength than extender mode. You can use D-Link's QRS (quick router setup) smartphone app to do all of the configuration.
customer_reviews.author: R. N. French

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Typical DLink web interface. The settings are very basic. Took me maybe three minutes to get it going. When you first plug it in, its unsecured. I recommend clicking thru every menu item. Also disable all that you don't need. There's a single power button, WPS button and on the bottom a reset button. There are four gigabit ports but with no indicators. Bad.
customer_reviews.author: S. L.

customer_reviews.title: Okay?
customer_reviews.text: I guess it worked but there is nothing you can measure or look at that tells you what's going on. We just switched to a Google WiFi router so I guess the D-Link goes in the sail bin.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyD

customer_reviews.title: Finally a device that was easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Claimed a four step installation process. Took me 5 minutes to set up, including opening the package, to being fully functional.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisA

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fast, I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and outstanding performance. Setup was straight forward, it comes with a fast setup guide on a little business card. I set it up as an access point, and it work really well. The range is awesome. Much better than some of my other access point, even the ones with 3 long range antennas. For the price, this is a great access point.
customer_reviews.author: D. Weng

customer_reviews.title: And it works like clock work
customer_reviews.text: I had an older D-Link Bridge and saw this. I had to have it. And it works like clock work. I have had this now for more than a month. It works so well I got I had it. Never had to reboot it or check the settings. That's a sign it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: I am a 36 year old tech savvy guy. Spent 6 hours trying to get this to work with DLink tech support.....won’t connect to my WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: J-Rod

customer_reviews.title: Great Signal
customer_reviews.text: Signal is great. I got this as a replacement for a Linksys extender that kept dropping connections. I have not experienced one dropped connection since installing the D-Link extender.
customer_reviews.author: Ed S.

product_meta.title: D-Link WiFi Range Extender Gigabit Ethernet Port AC1200 Dual Band Wireless MediaBridge and Access Point (DAP-1650)
product_meta.description: D-Link DAP-1650 wireless AC1200 Gigabit range extender is the ideal solution for improving the Wi-Fi coverage and wireless signal strength of any wireless network. Delivering the next generation 802. 11AC wireless connectivity and four Gigabit Ethernet ports The D-Link DAP-1650 Provides high-speed connectivity to stream HD video and connect multiple devices to your home network. Easy to setup with the push of the WPS button or use the qrs mobile app on your iOS or Android mobile device. The DAP-1650 is designed to operate as a Wi-Fi range extender, access point or media bridge providing flexible operation modes for any network environment.
feature_bullets: Simultaneous dual band Wi-Fi: Extend both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz Wi-Fi at the same time for greater flexibility and reduced interference
Superior range: Multiple antenna (MMO) technology provides superior coverage for hard to reach areas
GIGABIT Ethernet ports: 4 Gigabit LAN ports for high speed wired connections
Wi-Fi Protected setup: Push button for easy connection to a wireless network
Flexibility: Compatible with virtually any wireless router brand
Secure wireless encryption: Offers WPA or WPA2 security

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars813 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
